answers.answer: HiThough oral sex has less chance of transmitting sexually transmitted diseases, the possibility remains quite on the higher side. So it will be wise to get a STD panel done that covers all diseases from gonorrhea to HIV to syphilis to Chlamydia.However your symptoms could be due to stomach infection. You must be aware that diabetics have more chances of catching an infection. It could be something you ate too. The bloody patch could be simple hemorrhage or bleeding into your mouth’s mucus layer. However it is better not to ignore your symptoms. Please consult your doctor.It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted.

Went to the dr today. Symptoms seem like stress. Took an STD Panel. Thing in mouth was from biting cheek its almot gone already. Recieved Oral sex only CDC say very low risk as well as anyone else say no risk as long as there was no bleeding on my penis. There was no bleeding. After speaking to someone nausia has gone away my blood pressure was a bit high so he gave me pills for that same pills will help protect my kidneys i was told. Was also given a low dose of zocor for borderline cholestoral.Thanks for your help.

question: Ok I have Diabetes for 27 years now. Here is my problem. The past couple of weeks i started with kidney pain thinking a stone. but, now for the past 3 days iv had diareaha, Nausia, Occasional headache, When i think about Mabie hiv i sweat like crazy prob stress. last night i was eating a pretzel and scraped it on the side of my mouth when it started to bleed. Looked in scraped the cheek but i also have  a blood blister. I have bitten the side cheek before but never saw a blood blister. have only recieved oral sex
title: Diabetic, Now has Nausia, Diareah, Kidney pain, ...
